Beschreibung: Für eine detailierte Beschreibung besuche bitte die Github-Seite. Installation: Platziere einfach den Patch nach dem Weather Report mod in deinem Mod-Manager…
entry.content:
[Stable 1.0 for Weather Report 1.042]

Wetterbericht ist der deutsche Übersetzungspatch von Weather Report, ein Fallout 4 Mod von Greslin. Dieses wird benötigt.

Beschreibung:

Für eine detailierte Beschreibung besuche bitte die Github-Seite.

Installation:

Platziere einfach den Patch nach dem Weather Report mod in deinem Mod-Manager (am besten MO2).

Voraussetzungen:

  • Weather Report
    (Mod von Greslin. Das gibt es auf seinem Discord)

Bekannte Inkompatibilitäten:

  • nichts bekannt

Download:

Github

entry.title: Modding Tips
entry.summary: This is a growing link list for me personally with issues I had to deal with while delving into Creation Kit's functions. Ressources that helped me:
entry.content:
This is a growing link list for me personally with issues I had to deal with while delving into Creation Kit's functions.

Issues und Solutions
  1. NEVER load master files into CK you don't want to be master files for your mod. If you just want to look at stuff, load these masters alone. Otherwise you may get dependancies under odd circumstances.
  2. I want light sources to be dark at night / enhance natural sky light / according to the time of day
    Chiaro's Corner:  Day/Night emittance from windows (CK)
  3. Godrays drove me crazy. They just didn't show:
    - If you put the lightsource (like DefauktLightWhite01SpotGR) to close to your window, you only get a glow effect. Put it a bit farther away.
    - Reminder: You don't need a dustbox for godrays to show. GS are set on the lightsource
    - To get godrays right (In my case I want distinguisable section of light cut by the boarded-up window and also reach up to the opposite wall) play with the following variables: Distance to window, Intensity of the GR lightsource, Radius of the GR lightsource
     
    It's a game of trial and error to get it right to your situation and what you want to achieve. Keep the radius at the size of just the window or you risk leaking even through solid walls

 

Ressources that helped me:

  • Greslin's YT channel: FO4Edit and Mod Reconciliation Basics
  • Greslin: Lessons From a Lifetime of Scripting
  •

entry.title: Origins of Cryss' Interiors
entry.summary: During the last few month while playing FROST and Horizon I've always wondered what this or that building's story was and how nice it would be to enter them and if one even offered a little shelter and hideout during a rad storm. But how?…
entry.content:
During the last few month while playing FROST and Horizon I've always wondered what this or that building's story was and how nice it would be to enter them and if one even offered a little shelter and hideout during a rad storm. But how? There wasn't any content there to be entered. It had to be build!

There are a lot of other good mods out there that do a great job, but I wanted my own and because I had a creative impetus recently on the Horizon Discord where one fellow wastelanders asked what the requirements were for the new reclaimation site and how to keep track of it. So I spontaniously started a spreadsheet. And the impetus for being creativly productive lasted longer than this. Thankfully.

So I did a field trip ingame in Horizon 1.9 alpha and while I was also adding notes to my Prospector's Guide to the Wastelands, I was looking for nice places to explore and took notes and pictures. Plentiful!

The goals with my new modding Project Cryss' Interiors is:

  • Add new content to the Fallout universe (while being lore friendly)
  • Give something back to the community and have more interaction with its members
  • Learn new feats like scripting, level design, story telling, adding my own models and textures (Though, I'll always be a generalist, I'm afraid ...)
  • Stay FROST friendly:
    • No abundant loot
    • No full fletched player homes without any balancing

entry.title: Cryss' Interiors
entry.summary: [WIP / v0.2.8.1-beta] This mod is the first in my endavour to create my own collection of new interiors for Fallout 4. Thanks to all testers for their helpful feedback and thourough testing. Cryss Interiors contains the following new interior cells: Close to vendor Slim…
entry.content:
[WIP / v0.2.8.1-beta]

This mod is the first in my endavour to create my own collection of new interiors for Fallout 4.

Thanks to all testers for their helpful feedback and thourough testing.

Cryss Interiors contains the following new interior cells:

Apartments:

Close to vendor Slim / Mass Bay Medial Center

Fast Travel Point:

coc CryssIntApart

Concord Garage

Fast Travel Point:

coc CryssIntCGarage

Waystation Storeroom

South of Boston when you follow the railway tracks

Fast Travel Point:

coc CryssIntWS

Loft

Near Goodneighbor/Mass Fusion building up some stairs

- Experimental feature of gunfight to simulate a soundscape. (Need more user feedback if it is even worth it or if there are any issues with it)

Fast Travel Point:

coc CryssIntLoft

Valenti Restaurant

Directly above the station entry. For the time being I have put a door at the building on the left as a "service personnel access". My plan is to integrate this door and possible staircases into the interior cells of the station itself, but I need to check further plans of the FROST developers if they have anything planned as I don't want to mess with their plans. Having the area accessed through the subway would be much more immersive.

Fast Travel Point:

coc CryssIntVR

More interiors to come!

 

Where to get:

Github

Future Plans:

  • Customized workbenches
  • Little additions and mechanics without going beyond the scope of the mod

entry.title: Cryss' Defrosted Crops and Planters for Horizon 1.8
entry.summary: [dephracated] To increase immersion when doing a Horizon winter playthrough and restrict myself to only grow crops in my greenhouses I was frustrated by the fact, that all crops I place are snow covered. So I made this patch. It is my second mod now…
entry.content:
[dephracated]

To increase immersion when doing a Horizon winter playthrough and restrict myself to only grow crops in my greenhouses I was frustrated by the fact, that all crops I place are snow covered. So I made this patch. It is my second mod now and I hope everything is working for you.

Please note:
As I'm still earning to use CK and Xedit I couldn't find a smarter way of "restoring" the non-snow textures for specific items by just excluding them from the overwriting snow texture mod (I'm using Fallout 4 Seasons) I made a subfolder with renamed vanilla textures and bgms that I selected for every Horizon specific item like the automatic planters.

This is the first release and therefore there may be some inconsistencies or items that I have overlooked.

Thanks to Greb for the critical bugfix that was in my first release (0.5). (I better double check what CK does in the future. Lesson learned!). Get this version 1.0!

Requirements:

  • Horizon 1.8

Known Incompatibilities:

  • none known/reported yet

Where to get:

Github

entry.title: Cryss' Greenhouses
entry.summary: [Stable 1.0] Three greenhouses, all navmeshed (DLC required) (small, medium, large) I wanted to use with Horizon with a Winter playtrough. All three have a concret foundation for easier placement on unleveled ground. I didn't add any decoration so you have plenty of room to…
entry.content:
[Stable 1.0]

Three greenhouses, all navmeshed (DLC required) (small, medium, large) I wanted to use with Horizon with a Winter playtrough. All three have a concret foundation for easier placement on unleveled ground.

I didn't add any decoration so you have plenty of room to let your inner architect run wild!

There havn't been any bug reports so I call this stable.

The Greenhouses can be found in /Prefabs/Warehouses of the workshop menu.

Do you have nice screenshots and want to have them posted here? Please contact me.

Requirements:

  • All DLC

Known Incompatibilities:

  • none known/reported yet

Where to get it:

Github

entry.title: Prospector's Guide to the Wastelands (PGW)
entry.summary: I've started to create a spreadsheet to give an overview of all the sites of the new Fallout 4: Horizon 1.9.x reclamation system. The list also contains all the requirements (resources and perk ranks) to unlock the different tiers. At the moment some are missing…
entry.content:
I've started to create a spreadsheet to give an overview of all the sites of the new Fallout 4: Horizon 1.9.x reclamation system.

The list also contains all the requirements (resources and perk ranks) to unlock the different tiers.

At the moment some are missing and I will add them in the near future given that at this moment Horizon 1.9 is still alpha and in bug fixing phase. After that Zaw might change the requirements of the different sites for balancing purpose.

But it should give you an idea about the resources and perks needed before trying to unlock it.

I've also added checkboxes for you, so you can use a copy of the list yourself.

While I try to keep the list updated I can't guarantee it as I may take a break from Horizon or Fallout in general or do some other projects.

The list will always be free of course and if you want to add some nice screenshots or missing numbers you want to report feel free to contact me.

 

Prospector's Guide to the Wastelands (PGW):

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1nog9hw8JB3lVprp3YwPJIerMBO3vsZsL0VhQS6Wvu_o/edit?usp=sharing

You can reach me at my little modding corner at the MCR:

https://discord.com/channels/860638206906728508/1080407936318312498

Or at Gresling's Discord:

https://discord.com/channels/408380281209356299/606581678059814937/875546882590515230
